description: Redevelopment of 146-162 Kilburn High Rd to provide a 5 storey building (plus basement & sub-basement) in 2 blocks including 7 retail units, 14 intermediate flats & 56 private flats plus balconies & covered atrium; 30 sub-basement parking spaces with access from Kingsgate Place and 72 basement cycle parking spaces. Erection of mainly 3, but partly 2 additional storeys with roof terrace & balconies above existing supermarket building fronting Kingsgate Road comprising 11 affordable flats; plus new refuse stores on Kingsgate Road frontage; enclosed mechanical equipment above existing supermarket.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of five years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

Condition : 2 - Sample panels of all materials for each elevation to be erected on site and full details submitted to the Council; to include a sample panel of brickwork to show brick type, bond, mortar mix and pointing method. 
Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1 and EN13 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 3 - Notwithstanding Drg. Nos. SK1-13/01 and 03011 PER 02A, the Kingsgate Place elevational treatment is not approved and alternative proposals to facilitate an improved appearance between ground/mezzanine and upper floors, shall be submitted to and approved by the Council before the commencement of works on site.

Reason: To define the permission and to safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1 and EN13 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 4 - No meter boxes, flues, vents or pipes shall be fixed or installed on the [external face][street elevations] of the building.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1 and EN13 [and EN31 if in a CA] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 5 - Before the use commences sound insulation between all units in separate occupation shall be provided for the building in accordance with a scheme to be first approved by the local planning authority. The use shall thereafter not be carried out other than in complete compliance with the approved scheme.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policy RE2 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 6 - Before the use commences, details of the method of storage and waste removal (including recycled materials and ensuring inward opening refuse gates) shall be submitted to and approved by the Council and the approved method shall thereafter be maintained.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally, in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2, EN5, EN6 and DS6 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 7 - The details of all boundary treatment shall have been submitted to and approved by the Council before any work is commenced on the site and shall thereafter be implemented and maintained.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises, the amenity of occupiers of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policy EN19 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 8 - Before the use commences, details of hard landscaping in the forecourt on the Kilburn High Rd frontage to be submitted to and approved by the Council. Any trees or areas of planting which, within a period of 5 years from the completion of the development, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced as soon as is reasonably possible and, in any case, by not later than the end of the following planting season, with others of similar size and species, unless the Council gives written consent to any variation.

Reason: To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard of visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies EN15 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 9 - No more than one of the basement car parking spaces shall be allocated to non-residential uses and this provision shall not change without the prior consent of the Council. 

Reason: To deter unnecessary levels of commuter parking in accordance with the requirements of policy TR12 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 10 - Before the use commences, details of the proposed grille/vent coverings to the Kingsgate Place frontage to be submitted to and approved by the Council.

Reason: In the interests of highway safety in accordance with policy TR19 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 11 - At 1 metre outside the windows of any neighbouring habitable room the level of noise from all plant and machinery shall be at all times at least 5 decibels below the existing background noise levels, expressed in dB(A) at such locations. Where the noise from the plant and machinery is tonal in character the differences in these levels shall be at least 10 dB(A).

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2, EN5 and DS6 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 12 - The development hereby approved shall be undertaken in strict accordance with the submitted Environmental noise assessment. 

Reason: To define the permission and to safeguard the amenities of the premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2, EN5 and DS6 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 13 - Before the use commences, details of noise attenuation, soundproofing and external means of enclosure of the Somerfield supermarket roofplant that is to be retained, to be submitted to and approved by the Council and the external treatment to be maintained in a neat and tidy appearance. 

Reason: To define the permission and to safeguard the amenities of the premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2, EN5 and DS6 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 14 - Before the use commences, details of noise attenuation measures to all external doors, windows and any other external openings shall be submitted to and approved by the Council, such measures should measures achieve internal noise levels in bedrooms of 35dB LAeq, between 2300 and 0700 hours daily and individual noise events shall not exceed 45dB LA max, F.

Reason: To define the permission and to safeguard the amenities of the premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2, EN5 and DS6 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 15 - No additional plant or machinery shall be installed on any part of the premises hereby approvwed without the express consent of the Council.

Reason: To define the permission and to safeguard the amenities of the premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2, EN5 and DS6 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
